item.description:
Build a city, make a fortune.

“In Magnate: The First City, you’re a property developer out to build an empire in the midst of a citywide property boom.

By snapping-up valuable land and constructing the right buildings in the right locations, you’ll attract high value tenants and start raking in the big bucks. But beware: as the city grows, everything you build will also open up new opportunities for your competitors. Will you make a fortune? Or will you be caught out when the boom inevitably turns to bust in a game-ending market crash?”

---

Magnate: The First City is a midweight strategy game for 1-5 players. Each turn players try to grow their property empire by performing different actions, including: buying plots of land, constructing buildings, marketing their developments and selling them completely for their capital value. Once per round, they will also get the chance to attract tenants to any empty buildings they have. If they are successful, they will start collecting rent from their tenants and increase the value of their holdings. At the same time, they will also create new development opportunities for themselves and their opponents.

But in Magnate, as in real life, not all locations are equally appealing to all types of tenant. Magnate’s four types of tenant - residential, offices, retail and industry - all want to be linked to other types of tenant in nearby neighbourhoods. And they are all affected differently by what’s next door: The airport is an asset for offices, but it’s an unattractive place for new residents. By clever tactical and strategic building, players can increase their odds of attracting these tenants and improve their return on investment - without benefiting their opponents too much.

But while the players acquire more and larger properties, the price of land keeps rising higher and higher. Eventually, it becomes completely unsustainable and a game-ending crash that will destroy the value of players’ properties becomes inevitable. When exactly the crash happens, however, is shaped by the players: How much land they buy and how much property they sell will more make a crash on any specific turn more or less likely. Players must time their actions carefully to avoid substantial losses while maximizing their profits. Only then will they emerge victorious as the city’s wealthiest property magnate.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Puss in Boots is a roll-and-move game where the one player as Puss whose goal is to have his master marry the princess, and the other player as the King tries to thwart Puss in his attempt.

From McLoughlin Brothers' 1897 catalogue:

"This game is to decide whether Puss manages to marry his Master to the Princess or the King succeeds in outwitting the gifted but tricky feline. The play is of the simplest, being moves over a course by spins of the indicator, with suitable setbacks. The board and label are in full colors and gold"

You awaken with a splitting headache and no idea of how you got here. The wilderness stretches in every direction, and something howls in the distance. Your quest for answers will have to wait; first, you need to survive. Will you help the others that are stranded here or will you save yourself at any cost?

When two to four players find themselves marooned in the harsh wilderness, you must cooperate and compete to search for water, food, and tools that will be essential to your very survival. But your adventure holds many secrets. Every copy of Discover: Lands Unknown is unlike any other in the world. A mix of environments, storylines, characters, locations, items, and enemies have been engineered to tell a story unique to every copy of the game thanks to an algorithm that ensures no two copies are alike. Your copy will contain various tiles, cards, and tokens, each pulled from a shared pool of components, and the combination will be different from every other copy in the world.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The aim of The Noodle Game is to score the most points by picking up various value noodles from the box and placing them on your place without dropping them on the table.

At the start of the game, all players pick up their chopsticks, with the tips remaining in contact with their plates (the starting position). The youngest player starts and play continues clockwise. Each player, in turn, uses their chopsticks to try to pick up ONE noodle from the box and place in on their plate. Once the bottom end of the noodle leaves the box, the other players can lift their chopsticks from their plates and attempt to steal the noodle and place it on their own plate. Once any part of a noodle touches a plate, it is considered safe and cannot be stolen.

Woo Boo is an unusually judgmental game for friends, family, and total strangers. How well do you know your friends? And how well do they know you? Find out, as you take turns making opinions on three interesting topics, while other players try to guess what you really think. Will it be WOO or BOO? The answer isn't always black or white!

—description from the publisher

Apex K-Truck Racer is a resource allocation competitive racing board game in which two to six players take on the role of truck drivers who guide their vehicles, fueled by kinetic power cubes, on smuggling missions through the abandoned streets and roads of the old world. The K-trucker who earns more reputation points throughout the game is declared the winner.

Thematically, the game begins immediately after the players have successfully stolen from a Corporation Conglomerate, collecting some cargo and a bit of information that reveals secret warehouses along the escape route, where more resources are hidden. Each game represents a smuggling run from point A, the Conglomerate gates, to point B, the agreed-upon Drop Spot.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which each player takes actions to manage the allocation of K-Cubes on different areas of the truck to add speed, power-up its guns or to activate the drone sidekick that improves the vehicle. By doing this, truckers create unique strategies to achieve different goals during the mission, which reward them with prestige among their peers and employers.

Players must be quick because the Corporation is hunting down the smugglers to recover its resources. Players must also keep an eye out for the other Truckers, who will try everything they can to collect additional cargo and get to the destination first, even if that means shooting down another truck.

—description from the designer

AWARDS & HONORS

2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Design - Bronze
2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Art - Bronze
2018 - Catarse Board Game Prototype Contest (Brazil) - Top 5
2018 - The Game Crafter´s Board Game Rules Sanity Test - 66/80.

item.description:
Our kingdoms are under siege, the 9 kingdoms are in danger, be the most tactical general, defend yourself from invasion and be the first to liberate your kingdom.

Objective: Be the first to eliminate all Siege tokens in front of your castle zone, thus eliminating the Horde that awaits our defeat. Once all the Horde markers are eliminated, you will have won.

Round to round players have to go through the various actions of the game to recruit the powerful herores of the factions of the game to eliminate the Horde, combat the attacks, defend your kingdom and if you can hamper the work of the others so that each attack is to them to those that affect them and you are not the target of the new blow of the Horde.

The game can end in 2 ways, a) when a player eliminates all the siege tokens from their zone, b) when the 3 war end cards are placed next to the pile of theft (this rule is optional).

Players: 3 -6
Age .: 13
Duration: 20 - 60 min.
Cards: 90


Nuestros reinos están bajo asedio, los 9 reinos están en peligro, sé el general más táctico, defiendete de la invasión y se el primero en liberar tu reino.

Objetivo: Sé el primero en eliminar todas las fichas de Asedio frente a tu zona de castillo, eliminando así a la Horda que aguarda nuestra derrota. Una vez eliminados todos los marcadores de Horda, habras ganado.

Ronda a ronda los jugadores han de ir buscando a través de las diversas acciones del juego la forma de ir reclutando a los poderosos héroes de las facciones del juego para así eliminar la Horda. Combate los ataques, defiende a tu reino y si puedes obstaculiza el trabajo de los otros para que cada ataque sea a ellos a los que les afecte y no seas tu el objetivo del nuevo golpe de la Horda.

El juego puede terminar de 2 maneras, a) cuando un jugador elimina todas las fichas de asedio de su zona, b) cuando las 3 fichas de final de guerra se colocan al lado del montón de robo (esta regla es opcional).

Jugadores.: 3 -6 
Edad.: 13 
Duración.: 20 - 60 min.
Cartas.: 90

Sin Retorno ("Deadlock"), GAME IN SOLITARY

"And I was there, standing in the middle of that gloomy entrance, I did not know what I was doing or why I was here ... that voice, it rumbled in my head ... and something deep inside me told me that I should look something ... and that something was ... "

 
 Objective :::


Survive long enough to claim the objectives of the "Mission Letter", escape and thus win!

Set in the myths of Lovecraft, this game immerses you in the desperation of trying to escape from a mansion in which everything seems to attack you. Turn after turn you must decide whether to steal a new card, face evil or escape at full speed, but remember! You have a mission to accomplish, do not delay, time is running out and things get complicated, resources are agonizing or What is worse, you can fall into total madness.

Sin Retorno is a game in which the decision making is critical and only you know what you are looking for through the mansion or what is best for you.

—description from the designer

SIN RETORNO, JUEGO EN SOLITARIO
"Y yo estaba allí, de pie en medio de esa sombría entrada, no sabía lo que estaba haciendo o por qué estaba aquí ... esa voz, retumbó en mi cabeza ... y algo muy dentro de mí me decía que debería buscar algo ... y ese algo era ... "

 
 Objetivo :::


¡Sobrevivir el tiempo suficiente para reclamar los objetivos de la "Carta de Misión", escapar y así ganar!

Ubicado en los mitos de Lovecraft, este juego te sumerge en la desesperación de tratar de escapar de una mansión en la que todo parece atacarte. Turno tras turno debes decidir si robar un a nueva carta, enfrentarte al mal o escapar a toda velocidad, pero recuerda !Tienes una mision que cumplir, no demores, que el tiempo se acaba y se complican las cosas, se te agontan los recursos o lo que es peor puedes caer en la locura total.

Sin Retorno, es un juego en el que la toma de decisiones es critica y solo tú sabes que es lo que buscas a través de la mansión o que es lo que mas te conviene.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name.value: Dragon Boats of the Four Seas

item.description: In Dragon Boats of the Four Seas, Zhong-Guo, the Middle Kingdom, is an island surrounded by the four Dragon Seas. After a long period of strife, Zhong-Guo has once again been unified and the noble houses rise from the ashes, hoping to cross the Dragon Seas and reach the wealthy vassal states of the former Empire. In Zhong-Guo, Dragons are believed to be good luck and sources of celestial power, so the people make offerings to Dragons at temples and cast coins with the images of Dragons on them to bring fortune at the marketplace. Farmers invoke Dragons over their fields for a bountiful harvest and boats are made in the likeness of Dragons for protection on the dangerous waters. As the leader of one of the noble houses of Zhong-Guo, you must build farms, trade, and make offerings for the safe passage of your ships to these forgotten lands. Recapture the glory of the old Empire and ride the Dragon Boats to victory!

item.description:
Welterweights is a two player card programming and bluffing game that puts players in the mind of a boxer in the ring for an exhibition match. Players must choose cards carefully, outwit and predict their opponent, and land powerful combos in order to knock their opponent out. Knock out your opponent, or score the most points in 3 rounds in order to win.

Each turn players will look at cards from a right hand deck and a left hand deck, each with different maneuvers available. The boxers each choose their next four moves and program their hand, then resolve cards in order, simultaneously. Successful dodges and punches can set up powerful combos and add damage cards to their opponent's decks. Players win by dealing enough damage to land a knockout, or by having the most points at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

This game is based on Mackinac Island, a popular tourist spot in Michigan.

From the Publisher:
It's the simple game of familiar sights and fun surprises!

If you've ever been to Mackinac Island you'll certainly remember the fudge, Arch Rock and the Grand Hotel. All those things and more will show up in this quick game for the family.

Players travel the Island hoping to acquire the most Fun chips. Every location and event card will have directions to take more chips or pass them around. Your only choice will be when to stop rolling the die. Do you push your luck hoping for more Fun? Be careful not to Mack' Out!

The small box contains 11 cards, one die, one pawn, 50 Fun chips and rules.

Ascendancy: From Ashes To Empire is a medium-heavy 4x tabletop turn-based strategy experience, for 1 – 6 players.

It's inspired by classic video games such as Final Fantasy, Heroes of Might & Magic, Magic The Gathering, and Fire Emblem.

Gameplay features JRPG side style combat, branching class evolutions, worker & hex tile placement, area control, card drafting, secret win conditions, color themes, set collection, push-your-luck based encounters, and crafting! (whew).

Aesthetically, the game features high fantasy illustrations, with a dramatic, cinematic feeling.

—description from the designer

Champions of Arathus is a tabletop game for 3 to 6 players based on RPGs with medieval scenery, but without all those complicated rules of the genre. In this game, you and your friends assume the role of the adventurer at an unknown island in a quest the maximum glory of being the next Champion of Arathus.
Every match the players must fulfill a determined quest (which will be set at the beginning of the match), ranging from defeating unknown beasts to defending cities that have not been destroyed. It can put players against each other or make them work together to achieve a goal, forcing heroes to put their differences aside for a greater good.
Choose your weapon, wear your armor and discover this new and challenging land to become the new Champion of Arathus. Finally yet importantly, have fun!

Turn the tables on your enemies with disruptive new mechanics that let you attack and defend the base of your Staks!
16 new Bots across 60 cards bring a new wave of controlled chaos as you strive to manipulate and destroy all of your opponent's cards.

This is an expansion, but it does not require the original game to play (by using the online rules for the original).

GAME SYSTEM

 
 
 This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

 


The Universal Fighting System (UFS) is a collectible card game originally designed by Sabertooth Games. The themes of the cards are drawn from a multitude of licensed gaming universes, especially fighting game licenses.

A game in the Universal Fighting System represents a battle between two adversaries. Each player controls one of the two characters, with the objective being to defeat the opponent, typically through loss of vitality. The two characters need not be from the same universe; for example, Chun-Li from Street Fighter could battle Cassandra from Soul Calibur or Tycho from Penny Arcade.

Players take turns, with each turn consisting of multiple actions. With each additional action a player takes in a turn, the difficulty of successfully completing that action increases. Players can continue to take actions until they choose to stop or until they fail an attempt. The game structure typically involve players building up foundations over successive turns, which then allows a greater number of actions before failure. Management of these becomes crucial, as players must strike a balance between using their resources for offense and defense; going "all out" for a series of attacks can leave one vulnerable to retaliation during the opponent's turn. The system relies heavily on card combinations, where one card enhances the effect of another. The game is an advanced or expert level product (owing in large part to the fact that every card has at least one special ability), primarily aimed at older or more experienced gamers.

link.value: Universal Fighting System: Mortal Kombat X CCG
Universal Fighting System: Soul Calibur III
Universal Fighting System: Soul Calibur IV
Universal Fighting System: Warhammer – Age of reckoning Promo

item.description:
Brace yourselves for the revenge of the pugs is here — and it is hardcore.

Through selective breeding, we managed to make pugs one of the cutest dog breeds ever, but the short-snouted dogs couldn't care less about being adorable. Pugs are an anatomical disaster: They gasp and snort instead of breathing, their eyes don't work well, and their short limbs and twisted liver are a mess. They are more than ready to take revenge on humans. What could a bunch of cute little dogs do to harm us? Easy: Destroy our friendships!

In the socially unacceptable card game Pug You!, players are tackled by awkward questions from pugs such as "Who's got the worst professional prospects?", "Who needs to visit the hairdresser ASAP?", "Who is the most illiterate?", or "Who do you care about the least?" After nominating two players, everyone else gets to vote between those two! The most voted player scores that pug's badges.

Can your relationships endure the revenge of the pugs?

item.description:
In Fuji, you play as a group of adventurers on their way to Japan‘s most famous volcano, Mount Fuji. But just before you arrive at your destination, the earth begins to shake and the volcano erupts! Now your group must escape the deadly lava flows as quickly as possible to reach the safe village.

In this cooperative dice game, players simultaneously and secretely roll their dice behind their screens in each round. During the game, you must find the best way across a certain number of terrain cards to the safe village for each player. Each terrain card has a given dice requirement. You can move to a card only if you match this requirement better than both your neighbors — but since you know only your own dice and can communicate only vaguely, you will need both skill and luck to save yourselves.

The game ends with a success if all players reach the village. It fails if one of you falls victim to the lava or becomes too exhausted to proceed.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
An exceptional party game where imaginary ancient Egyptians are trying to overcome the language barrier with… Aliens.

In each turn Aliens would draw weird symbols, trying to explain which earthly items they’d like to collect. Puzzled Egyptians are to figure out what this could mean. On top of that, Aliens compete for being the first to grab the souvenirs and fly back home, while each human wants to be the best at learning the Alien language!

«First Contact» is perfect for associative-deductive games lovers. The unique theme adds even more fun to the game process, and every setup gives players new puzzles to solve. Incredibly good time guaranteed!

item.description:
Go Figure is a fast and simple children dexterity game. Every card, picturing animal, object or person, consist mainly from three types of figures and three colors. Game has four unique play variants for different ages - find what is on a picture for youngest players, find unique figure and absent figure for older kids, and find the best combination for mixed ages. Like many dexterity games, Go Figure is easy to teach and deliver fun not only for kids, but for people of all ages!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The wizard of the tribe has died. As it has been recorded by our ancestors, for thousands of years wizard-wannabes made their predictions for the ostrich race in the Holy Cave, with the one making the more accurate predictions becoming the new wizard. Which ostrich will win the race? Who will become the new wizard? The answers are not easy since it is an open secret that candidates are not limited just to making predictions...

In Banjooli Xeet, players become wizards who must predict the order of arrival of racing ostriches in order to gain points, while dodging obstacles, collecting berries, avoiding the dreaded lion, and not waking the sleeping crocodiles.

This second edition of Banjooli Xeet incorporates the Kanasu expansion, a single ostrich that sometimes joins the race, that cannot be scared, and that no one can gain points for if it wins. In addition, some minor rules were changed, rules for the lion tile were added, and some tiles from the first edition were replaced with new tiles that are intended to make the game faster and more fun.

item.description:
The goal of the game is to fly highest with your plane.

5 different planes start to fly to the center of the board. Each player has is own plane in front of him/her. Shuffle the deck and deal 5 cards to each player. In his turn player may play any plane on the table near the same plane (to fly with this plane).
If you cover any other plane with your card, the covered plane is out of game.

If you are the last pilot in game you are the winner.
If the deck runs out the player in game who´s value in his/her last card is the biggest is the winner.

—user summary

DealMaker is game of wild negotiations and cunning interactions. Trade, exchange, and make the best deals possible.

Play starts with each player holding three merchandise cards in hand. The possible merchandises are peanuts, vinegar, flowers, carpets, gold, and diamonds. Players trade cards with each other in a free fashion. They compete to close deals that are placed face up in front of them. Once a deal is closed, the closer draws cards. If no deal is closed, all player agree to draw a card.

The game ends when all deals have been made or when there are no more cards to draw and no more players can close a deal. The player with the highest number of points (total sum of all deals) wins the game.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The general idea of the wooden game Staka is to stack and win, and the game comes with five modes of play:


 In Duel mode, two players compete to stack figures before their opponent. The first with five figures completed wins the game.
 In Flash mode, the players try to complete the figure against the clock, which is represented by a die that opponents roll and add up.
 In Crash mode, it's the first to crash the construction that loses.
 In Zen mode, take your time, put on your noise-cancelling headsets, and try to complete the twenty challenges in the game.
 In Arte mode, unleash your creativity and build new figures.


—description from the publisher

A touch-and-feel game where players take turns rolling the die and racing to "feed" their bait pieces to the hungry shark. The first player to run out of pieces wins.

Includes zippered plush shark, 16 sturdy bait pieces, die, and instructions for two ways to play.

FIGHTING OPERATION UNTHINKABLE
At the end of May 1945, it is highly doubtful the Soviet Government is going to allow democratic processes in the countries they occupy. As Prime Minister Churchill feared, it appears the Russians are not going to honor the agreements made between Allies concerning the future of Central and Southern Europe. To impose the will of the United States, The British Empire, and their Allies, the Joint Planning Staff draws up plans for Operation Unthinkable, a plan completely dependent on strategic surprise and the support of other European powers, including those they liberate. Outnumbered 2 to 1 in men and materiel, the Allies will need every advantage in the opening offensive in a war that many thought was over for Europe. D Day is set for 1 July 1945…

—description from the publisher

Murder in a small town! Join a band of loyal friends seeking to uncover the real villain in the ghastly murder of the beloved Nurse Judy. This Homebrewed Cthulhu-esque board-game uses cooperative play on a 3d terrain map of a small New England town from the 1920's.

In this cooperative game, players move around the game board uncovering clues and revealing alibis for the members of the Town Council, all of whom are suspects of the murder. Work with the other players to deduce which Town Elders committed the murder, and reveal their hidden motive.

As players move around the board, they may draw cards from two decks, a Event deck, and a Town Deck. Event cards reflect general occurrences in the town, as well as the actions of the Villain as they attempt to hinder the investigation. The Town cards contain rumors and gossip that allows the players to discover who the real culprit and their secret motive through a process of elimination.

—description from the designer

Players have the same number of colored cards. In turns, they must put a card over the discard pile, but when an "Atenti" card is played, the player must choose somebody, and he then must say which cards are in the discard deck, in the right order.
The winner is who plays first all his cards.

The new Global War 1936-1945 is coming!!!

After years of receiving and listening to our customers from around the world and compiling untold pages of feedback we have produced a full revision of our Global War rules, map and added a lot.


New units include:


· Tank Destroyers

· Self-Propelled Artillery

· Heavy Battleships

· Heavy Carriers

· Fast Battleships

· Battlecruisers

· Light Cruisers

· FEC Gurkhas


The revised map is very exciting. We’ve continued to update place names and features to reflect historical accuracy. To our map we have now printed air and naval bases, coastal artillery and fortifications onto the map directly. You will also find new types of air bases as well as Major and Minor shipyards, Minor Ports, and Dockyards. The railways now are designated as standard gauge (1,435mm) and broad gauge (1520mm and wider). We’ve added deserts, and jungles, channel ports, and more!

We have also updated significantly the rules for convoy raiding and escorts and added many new rules, new technologies, and revised all the play aids and National Reference sheets for greater clarify and playability. We have fixed some loop holes and added clarity and examples everywhere we could. In short, this has been a community effort with people from many countries contributing their knowledge, time and experise for the love of the game.

Global War is, and will continue to be the most expanded game of its time with some 30 expansions and counting already produced we will soon add linking games to 1946 and 1914 with a flurry of expansions for each.

—description from the publisher

Trivial Pursuit is a roll-and-move trivia game where players try to collect different colored "wedges" in their player wheel, and than make it to the center of the game board.

Trivial Pursuit: Editie Antwerpen is a smaller version with only 60 cards.

Categories:

Blue: Aardrijkskunde
Pink: Amusement
Yellow: Geschiedenis
Purple: Kunst & Literatuur
Green: Wetenschap & Natuur
Orange: Sport & Ontspanning
A game for children in which they roll dice and match them to animal tokens. A matching set of animals wins the game.

“Do not try to do too much with your own hands. Better the Arabs do it tolerably than that you do it perfectly. It is their war, and you are to help them, not to win it for them. Actually, also, under the very odd conditions of Arabia, your practical work will not be as good as, perhaps, you think it is.”
T.E. Lawrence, Arab Bulletin, August 20, 1917

The Arab Spring that began in 2010 spread across the greater Middle East and North Africa. With little exception, it has not been resolved peacefully or resulted in greater democratic representation. Syria remains embroiled in a civil war that started in March 2011 and the immature Iraqi government was easily contested by the growth in Islamic State in Syria and Levant (ISIS).

Nothing is more horrific than the actions of ISIS, also known as DAESH (Dawla al-Islamiya al-Iraq al-Sham), and this game is not intended to glorify them in any way. ISIS is a radical extreme with megalomaniac goals that has fed off the turmoil and instability of this region inside the Fertile Crescent. Their actions fall into three broad categories: atrocities in Syria or Iraq, atrocities inspired by their radical ideas occurring outside the region, and other external ISIS planned and executed events—largely in Europe.
Western powers have attempted a multitude of approaches with each of the revolutionary uprisings but the global ambitions of ISIS placed them in direct confrontation. Of all the contestants, ISIS is the most aggressive, far reaching and extreme in their methods; ensuring that they cannot be ignored or contained without direct intervention.

—description from the publisher

Our climate is changing and the elements that prevail in the forest are unstable. We experience this by dealing with the effects of violent weather phenomena such as: drought, storm or heavy rainfall. We have no direct influence on them, but we can predict the effects they cause and try to prevent them. We can counteract some of these changes, others need to be adapted to. The way we manage water and how we protect forests against fires is crucial in adapting forests to climate changes. Keeping forests in good condition is your task now.
It is your decisions and your actions that determine whether you manage the elements of fire and water.
"Å»ywioÅ‚y Lasu" is an original board game designed to be played individually among several people. The game balances the aspect of luck and the impact of player's decisions on the course of the game. Clear and intuitive rules allow you to quickly feel the vibe of the game regardless of age or experience with board games. Protect your forest from the effects of the forces of the elements, be ready for possible disasters and make sure the forest lasts longer for the benefit of people and nature.

In each round, players simultaneously pick the card with action which they will perform on the board and then pass the cards to the next player. The action is to place their marker in one of the forest zones: red, blue or neutral respectively. At the end of the game, after an appropriate number of rounds, the players gain points for the advantages in the regions or the proper arrangement of their markers in relation to each other and the selected cards during the game. The winner is the player who collects the most points.

RATH
Race Against The Horde

Goal: To be the first survivor of the zombie outbreak to complete 3 Survival Missions.
 Premise: You are one of the few surviving humans in a zombie infested world. Your town, once full of beautiful trees and parks is now decaying and run down. There are a few groups of fellow survivors with base camps set up around the town. Through your walkie-talkie a distress call is heard requesting that a supply run be done as soon as possible. You accept the task and start off on your journey. Along the way you come across floods, fires, zombie hordes, and military fall out. At the end of the journey, you are the hero that helped save mankind from annihilation.
 
Game Board: Movement can only be done on spaces that have grid lines. Players cannot move through bushes and trees or walk on water. The buildings can be accessed by any space surrounding the border. 
Daily Update Cards: The Daily Update cards effect game play in different areas of the board. Hazards in this zombie infested city slow down a players’ travel time, move them back to their home base, or force detours from their original path. Multiple grids on the map can be effected at once and each player must comply.
Survival Mission Cards: Each player will have one Survival Mission at a time to fulfill. Each player has a separate base camp of survivors they are trying to keep alive. By completing the missions on the cards, each player saves human lives by delivering life sustaining goods such as food, water, weapons, or building supplies to repair dilapidated structures.
To Start: Shuffle Survival Missions cards and place on corresponding space on board. Shuffle the Daily Update cards and place on the corresponding space on board. Place each colored playing piece on the corresponding colored home base buildings on the map. This means each player will have a different starting position based on the color of their piece. 
Each player picks a random Survival Mission at the beginning of the game. The mission does not start until the player reaches the first building to pick up supplies and the mission does not end until the player reaches the destination to drop off supplies. Once complete, the player turns the card over and picks another Survival Mission to start on the next day/turn. Once a player has completed 3 successful Survival Missions, they are the winner of the game.
Player Movement: Each player can move a maximum of 5 spaces per day (turn) unless specified on the Daily Update card. Players can move horizontal, vertical, and diagonal. 
Game Play: One (1) Daily Update card is drawn per day (turn) and effects each player on the board for that day/turn only. 
The youngest player at the board is the first to draw a Daily Update card. Each player moves based on the Daily Update card in a clockwise manner, starting with the card drawer first. For example, player one reads the Daily Update card and is slowed from maximum movement of 5 spaces to 2 spaces. Their turn is over and now player two reads the same Daily Update card and makes their move.

Solo Una Noche is a luchador themed card game for 2-4 players. Featuring 1v1, tag team, and melee modes, this game plays in about 10 minuets per player. Simple math to calculate damage and cards that encourage narrative and excitement make this a great choice for everyone 9 and up. 
Solo Una Noche features turn based card play in which players compose attacks from their hand of cards to damage the other player(s). The defending player has the opportunity to respond. Damage is applied and then change turns. Play continues until one player can be pinned, submitted or knocked out. 
Solo Una Noche punches above it’s weight class as a great go to game for quick take that fun while you wait for your friends to finish that other long game or for everyone else to show up to game night.

name.value: The Refuge: Terror from the Deep

item.description:
The Refuge: Terror from the Deep is a new, standalone version of B&B's iconic board game The Refuge: A Race for Survival.

In Terror from the Deep, 2-6 divers compete by racing to the goal and planning movement to outwit their opponents — all while escaping from the Kraken's wrath! The Refuge is an easy to learn, family-friendly racing game, and great gateway game to miniatures! The object of the game is simple: Be the first to the refuge with the treasure, and you are the winner of the game.

On your turn, you either move your character orthogonally, draw a card, or play an action card. As you move you activate tiles, allowing you to do different things, like the spawn tile, which spawns pesky tentacles that slow your opponents down, the hazard tile which lets you control the Kraken's tentacles. Combining your hand of cards with your movement allows you to string together combos propelling you toward the final goal. Wait too long though, and there will be a dozen tentacles blocking your path.

The Refuge: Terror from the Deep also features a new 1-4 player cooperative mode in which players work together to escape the Kraken!

—description from designer

The Refuge: A Race for Survival

item.description:
A kid's dexterity game where an igloo is built up and the players have to remove one iceblock after another without collapsing the whole igloo. The player which collapses the igloo looses, that player who has collected the least iceblocks wins.

Teaser:
The clever penguin Fred and his cool gang are determined to get the fish from Totti's igloo. But the door is locked! Therefore, they have to carefully remove one block of ice after the next from the igloo wall. However, grumpy old Totti is keeping guard on top of the igloo and he's not tho be tangled with! Pssst! Totti is looking to the other way! Help the gang of penguins to take advantage of this opportunity and carefully and gradually remove the igloo wall. But don't let the igloo collapse or Totti will catch you and the game will be over!

name.value: World in Flames Collector's Edition Super Deluxe

item.description:
It is the dawn of September 1939, and the dark clouds of war hover over the globe. China and Japan have already been at war for more than 2 years and now a Continental war is about to become a worldwide war, a World in Flames.

You, as leader of your nation, must guide your country through its darkest days, enhancing your economy, working with allies, building the units you need and then employing them effectively to defeat your manifold foes.

You are in charge of your country from 1939 until 1945 or until you conquer or fall. How you use your assets is up to you. Each country has its own special abilities and capabilities based on your country's skills aptitude and leadership. And of course there is the all important field of diplomacy where how you negotiate the minefield of international relations can be the difference between victory and defeat.

Only one player can win, but you have to be on the winning side to be that player. So you want to help your allies JUST enough so your side wins but not so much that it is not you that gains all the glory you clearly deserve. Give my chums all support short of help is my war-winning strategy.

World in Flames shows the entire world and will be the world's biggest boardgame. That's right, for the first time ever all maps and displays will be hard-mounted boards with bound edges.

Furthermore all the counters are now die-cut not knife cut so no more flash and no more wrestling with the cardboard stem before it gives up its precious offspring counters. The game is sumptuous, with some of the most beautiful counters ever printed. Each one lovingly hand-crafted and individually assessed and valued. The overall look of the game and counters is a work of art.

World in Flames can be played from 2 to 6 players (and can easily be played solitaire too). There are 20 campaigns you can play, from the hour long Victory in The West campaign to the 150 hour Global War mega campaign. World in Flames is the ultimate gaming challenge.

GAME RATING

Scope: Global Strategic 
 Complexity: Scenarios - Moderate, Campaigns - High
 Solitaire: Highly Suitable
 Players: Up to 6
 Ages: 12 to Adult

—description from the publisher

link.value: World in Flames Collector's Edition Deluxe

item.description:
Roygbiv is a tavern at the end of the rainbow. As it is hard to reach, only wizards generally gather there. Whenever there is a dispute among wizards, there is - of course - only one way to resolve this: a magical fight to the death.

Team up with friends (or don't) and cast spells at each other until the first offending wizard has perished. Choose from 7 archetypes with each 12 unique and themed spells. Build your initial deck, and pick up new spells to stop enemy strategies or expand on your own, as you play.

Cast magic missiles, boost your allies' spells and suppress those of your opponents. Summon lightning totems, goats or obese wisps. Swamp your foes in dark magic or drain them from their life force. Gain spell power to increase your strength, or cower behind a barrier.

Start the game by choosing a wizard (this gives you a unique ability, and choice from a specific set of cards at the start). Then, pick your spell cards to assemble your deck. Take turns to gain mana, cast spells (paying that mana) and pick up new spells (unrestricted) to add to your deck. The first wizard to remove the last white "life" mana from another wizard's pool (effectively killing them), is the winner!

name.value: The Partisans: An Extra Politics Board Game

item.description:
The Partisans is a tabletop game for 4-6 players based on the Extra Credits mini-series, Extra Politics. In the game, you play a political ideology attempting to move the government towards your goals. Of course, other players have different ideas about what the government should be doing.

Players take turns as the Committee Chair and work together to craft bills from amendment cards. All the players then vote on weather or not to pass the bill. VP are scored if players vote with the ideals of their faction and players gain extra power by voting with their lobbies.

When the game ends, a round of final scoring takes place based on the currant priorities of the government. The player with the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher

In Futuropia, Friedemann Friese's big utopian economic game for 1-4 optimizers, players live in a future Utopian society that possesses desirable lifestyle qualities for all of its citizens. Too bad this is not today's reality...

In this Utopian society, we all will work much less. Our robots can do nearly everything already. There is no need for great envy. It is simply about equality, justice, and the fair allocation of the complete and still necessary work, which then gives us ALL more leisure time.

Success means we will have time for the activities we like the most: fishing, farming, fencing, flying, ..., as well as gaming, building, painting, traveling, composing, and more. If somebody wants to work more than needed, they should do that. This is about the freedom! So let us rethink this: joblessness is not a disgrace, it is the new goal!

We are members of a team striving to realize this utopian ideal. We try to develop completely self-sustaining homes that function as efficiently as possible. They must generate enough food and energy to allow the residents the greatest possible freedom (thus, leisure time). The more people in our development who no longer need to work, the closer we are to reaching our goal! The player who builds the best development will win the game, and their development will become reality!

Futuropia is a luck-free economic game. To ensure you always encounter new challenges, we offer multiple game set-up variations, which create a variety of gameplay situations, ensuring new experiences and replayability. The solo game offers you an option to learn the mechanisms and processes of Futuropia before you play it with other players. See our hopeful future in...Futuropia!

item.description:
In this set collection programming card game, your old mentor has invited you to the unveiling of his masterpiece, a modular perpetual motion machine, only to disappear just as the event is about to begin! It is up to you, his former apprentices, to save the day and demonstrate this strange machine in his absence. Wow the audience, earn Prestige for your mentor, and discover the bizarre secrets of Doctor Smuglfreud's Marvelous Machine!

The premise is simple: module cards can interact with each other to generate a perpetual cycle of movements. There are many ways to get it right...but even more for things to go horribly awry! As you experiment with the temperamental machine, you will learn how to assemble sets of cards to make sensational combinations.

Three modes vary gameplay and win conditions:


 Rival Mode: compete with your rival to earn the most Prestige within the round limit.
 Demo Mode: work together or alone to earn the goal amount of Prestige (or more!) as quickly as possible.
 Puzzle Mode: work together or alone to create one spectacular design.


This game was first developed as an entry in the 2018 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest, where it won several awards:


 #1 Most Innovative Mechanic
 #2 Most Thematic Game (Steampunk)
 #3 Best Artwork (Giampiero Randazzo)
 and more...


Features:

 Award-winning print-and-play game
 Art from the MARVELOUS Giampiero Randazzo
 Three game modes with distinct flavors and playstyles (competitive timed, cooperative/solo timed, cooperative/solo untimed)
 Ultra-portable components, including an optional custom tuck box
 Design codes for sharing configurations or asynchronous play
 Top hat not included




—description from the designer

item.description: A football game with several air blowers that throws a polystyrene ball around. Launched as a counterpart to Exin-Basket Baloncesto. After the original publisher EXIN went bankrupt, the game was redesigned and launched by Inovac Rima SA, still as Exin Gol.

A woman has come to your PI agency asking you to help track down her missing friend. He's gone missing, last seen on an adventure with the eccentric Professor Challenger. They recently returned from a lost valley filled with strange creatures, but Ned is still missing. Track down the professor and help bring back Ned to his friend!

Expedition: Challenger is an Unlock! adventure for up to six players. With just one hour on the clock, players must work through a deck of sixty cards as a team, searching for clues, combining objects, and figuring out puzzles to solve the mystery and escape the countdown timer. The free Unlock! app runs the timer while providing clues, giving hints, and helping players succeed. Once the team has reached the solution and entered the correct code, they've escaped, and the game has been won!

item.description:
Who will scale up? Each player puts together a dragon by sliding cards into each other, one by one. The goal is to end up with the grandest and tallest dragon. Easy enough, if the dragon does not topple due to miscalculation of your own or an attack by another player. So beware of the spouts of fire, the lashes of tail or the trembling caused by the dragon dance! The player whose dragon overcomes the attacks and stands tallest when the cards run out wins.

The game is a simple building challenge. The cards are coasters, with slits in them, so you can slide them together and they'll hold fast fairly well - at least until the whole thing comes crashing down.

You won't lose the game (necessarily) if that happens - the game isn't over until all the cards are played. That's a nice change of pace from most dexterity games, where a crash is a loss.

—user summary

Cry Wolf is a fast simultaneous play bluffing micro game for two players. Each player either takes the role of the shepard boy or the wolf. The boy wins by crying wolf as the wolf attacks five times. The wolf is trying to sneak past the boy and eat five sheep.
This game also involves a hand management. Running out of cards as the boy means you've lost credibility and can not defend you flock for a turn. As the wolf running out of cards represents starving off.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Churrasco Carnival is a "who can eat the most" type of game, with a Tetris-like mechanism. Each turn, cards are drawn and players choose to eat or not, trying to fit the pieces of meat (coming in polyomino shapes) in their stomach. For each horizontal row completely filled, that food is digested, and the player gets points depending on what kind of food (meat) the row mostly consisted of. Special stomach sizes grant bonus points. The player with the most points after a certain amount of rounds wins.

The game is also playable as a solitaire endeavor, with you trying to reach the maximum number of points and beating the ghost player.

item.description:
Who can reconstruct the raven-black scenes of the murderous script?

Total chaos in the film studios! In a burglary, everything was devastated and important scripts were stolen. The players are scriptwriters and have the task to rewrite the scripts. It helps that some scenes that are already shot, as well as the director.

The director draws a director's card and reads the script through. Only he knows the complete murderous script. He reads the screenplay and the introduction to his scriptwriters, puts on the first film scene and off you go! The scriptwriters have to guess with yes / no questions what happened here and what happens next - only then they get the next scene given by the director as a “reward”. If the scriptwriters have guessed all six scenes and the complete murderous script is shot, the next round starts and another player is allowed to play the director.

In Bukiet, players grow flowers on their personal sheets. The dice symbolize customers who want to buy certain types of flowers. Players cut flowers in their fields to make bouquets for their customers to score points, but each flower can be cut only once, so try to keep your customers happy! You have several ways to win. Become the best flower grower!

In more detail, the game is divided into rounds, and at the start of a round the active player throws all six dice. Starting from the first player, in clockwise direction, each player chooses one customer and encircles flowers in the correct color on their personal sheet. This means that the flowers have been cut from the player's field. When all players have chosen one die, the round ends, then the player on the left of the active player begins the next round. The game ends when at the end of the round a player has:


 Cut all flowers in three colors, or
 Cut all flowers in four of the six fields.


You can score bonus points if you have the fewest unhappy customers. The player with the most points wins.

item.description:
black stories has been the riddle game series with goosebumps and bestsellers for over 13 years. Sebastian Fitzek is Germany's most successful psycho-thriller author with over 10 million books sold. The new edition brings together both: 25 stories from the thriller cosmos by Sebastian Fitzek - without taking away the excitement of the books - and 25 brand new black stories from the master of horror.
 black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Who’s going to snatch the best questions?

(Come on) Let's Quiz Again is played over six rounds. Choose a quiz card in each round. Sometimes you answer on your own, sometimes in a team. And you can fob one of your fellow players off with one of the quiz cards. If you give a correct answer, you gain points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Who will solve the cockroach problem?

In Schaben jagen, the player draws a task card, places the game pieces as indicated on the game board and takes the illustrated movement cards. His task: To move the exterminator so skillfully that he catches all cockroaches. To do so, he must play his movement cards in the correct order. He can only use each of them once. After that, all cockroaches run into a field. Sitting a cockroach in a straight line to the exterminator, he sucks them and takes them from the field. The task is fulfilled if he gets all the cockroaches before he runs out of motion cards.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
As a real rogue, you bag plenty of loot. So much that you have to stash it away in treasure troves. If only you could remember where the heck you have hidden it. 18 doors – and they all look identical. But where was that trap hidden again? Can you stay on top of things?

Go through all the treasure troves, one by one. As you go, each in turn says the number of the next treasure trove. Start with “1” and work your way through to “18”. It sounds easy enough, but be careful: some of the treasure troves have traps hidden in them. In that case, you don’t say the number, but must say a code word or make a secret sign instead. That’s the only way to escape the trap. Have your fellow rogues caught you making a mistake? Bad luck, now you collect penalty points. Have you caught one of the others? Good luck, then you receive points. At the end of the game, who is the one with the best memory and the most points?

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Once upon a time a witch lived alone in her house in the depths of the forest. Her favorite hobby was baking yummy gingerbread; in fact, she loved gingerbread so much that she built her entire house out of it. Unfortunately, she wasn't the only one who loved it! Rude fairy tale characters passing by were eating away her walls, windows, and doors! One day, the witch decided that she'd had enough of them all helping themselves and, paying attention to which types of gingerbread these greedy intruders liked the most, she came up with an idea on how to get rid of them once and for all...

In Gingerbread House, you place domino-like tiles in a 3 by 3 grid, covering symbols that provide you with four different types of gingerbread and special actions. Tiles may also be placed on existing types of tiles, forming a 3D structure in front of you. Covering two of the same symbol is extremely valuable as it provides a bonus gingerbread or action. Victory points are awarded for building the tallest structure, completing orders by discarding sets of gingerbread, as well as being the quickest to achieve certain conditions. In the end, the player with the most victory points wins.

item.description:
Jenga, but under the tower you have a base with two handles. On your turn you will hold the base while doing the usual Jenga stuff, and at the end of the turn you pass the tower to the next player.

The game also comes with ten more or less silly extra challenges.

name.value: Pocket Escape Room: Het Mysterie van Eldorado

item.description:
Deckscape: The Mystery of Eldorado is the fourth title in a series of cooperative games inspired by real escape rooms in which a group of people is "trapped" inside a room full of puzzles and odd items. The goal of the game is to solve puzzles, understand the plot of the story, and make intelligent use of the items provided in order to exit from the room as quickly as possible.

In Deckscape: The Mystery of Eldorado, you are a group of explorers, who have long sought the legendary golden city in the heart of the forest, without finding it. While you are flying back home, the head of a statue crashes against the plane and you have to parachute to safety! You are alone, tired and hungry, lost in an uncharted area of the forest. Danger is lurking, and you have only the few items you grabbed before jumping out. This could be your end...or the very last chance to unravel the mystery of Eldorado! Can you survive the pitfalls of the Amazon forest and find the legendary city of Eldorado?

item.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 340 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards, and may only look at the descriptions. Each player in turn puts a card on the table, trying to put them in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order was correct then the doubting player receives four cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives two cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure and are hard to date.

To rebuild the Eternal City, the Roman Emperor summoned the most talented builders of antiquity. Each of them is trying to draft the best city — but talent is not enough. Only those who know how to please the Emperor, cleverly exert their influence, and invest at the right time will succeed in City of Rome.

In more detail, the game lasts fourteen rounds, and in each round, players draft one of the building cards in play and add it to their hand. The drafting order depends on how closely you stand to the emperor. At the start of a round, you reveal a new "action strip" that has three bricks and two cogs in some order, then players take turns placing their figure on one of these five spaces; the closer you are to the emperor, the earlier you draft, but the fewer resources (bricks and cogs) you receive. (With only two players in the game, each player places two figures on the action strip and takes two complete turns each round.)

After drafting, you can take one build action and one produce action. To build, you must pay the cost in bricks — paying two coins for each missing brick — then place the card you're building adjacent to another card of yours already in play. You start with two building cards in play, so you'll have at most sixteen cards at game's end. These cards must fit in a 4x4 square, so plan carefully since you'll want to place some buildings next to other ones to earn the most points and to get the most out of a produce action. Some buildings give you a special action or influence tokens when you build them.

To produce, you must have two cogs — paying one coin for each missing cog — then use the production action of each building in your city once.

Every few rounds, an influence card is revealed, and whoever has the most influence tokens at the end of that round collects the card, then discards their tokens.

At the end of fourteen rounds, players score points for their residential buildings, temples, aqueducts, coins, and influence cards and tokens. whoever has the most points wins!
